intro: Erigeron consanguineus, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces small blue to purple flowers. Erigeron consanguineus is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
